decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Drawing no 2023/00 OSMAPEXTRACT (Site Location Plan)
 Drawing no. 2023/11/Rev A (Site Plan) Dated 01/2023
 Drawing no. 2023/12/Rev B (Proposed Ground Floor & First Floor Plan 1 of 2) Dated 08/03/2023
 Drawing no. 2023/13/RevA(Proposed Roof Space Plan & Proposed Roof Plan)Dated 01/2023
 Drawing no.2023/14/RevB(Proposed Front East Elevation & Rear West Elevation)Dated 08/03/2023
Drawing no 2023/15/RevB(Proposed North & South Elevations Plan)Dated 08/03/2023.
Drawing no. 2023/16/RevA(Proposed Sections A - A Section B-B )Dated 01/2023
Drawing no. TPP -01/RevA (Tree Constraints Plan & Tree Protection Plan) Dated 05/02/2023.
Arboricultural Impact Method Assessment Statement Report by I S Thompson Dated 5th February 2023. 
Design and Access Statement 
 See Condition 2

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Tree Protection: The details and measures for the protection of the existing retained trees as specified in the hereby approved document 'BS5837 Arboricultural Method Statement' reference 'AC.2023.074' dated '5 February 2023' and the Tree Protection Plan numbered 'TPP-01 Rev.A' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the report and shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works. 

Reason: To protect and safeguard the existing trees in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and 02 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 5 - Tree Protection:
 The details and measures for the protection of the existing retained trees as specified in the hereby approved document 'BS5837 Arboricultural Method Statement' reference 'AC.2023.074' dated '5 February 2023' and the Tree Protection Plan numbered 'TPP-01 Rev.A' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the report and shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works. 

Reason: To protect and safeguard the existing trees in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and 02 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 6 - "	Site Supervision (Trees) - The details of the approved 'BS 5837 Arboricultural Method Statement' shall include the retention of an arboricultural expert to supervise site works as set out in the document. A report on the status of all tree works and tree protection measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority following each site visit. A final Certificate of Completion shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority at the conclusion of all site works. The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan. 

Reason: To protect and safeguard etc.,

Condition : 7 - Landscaping: 
Details of the proposed species and location of the 4 extra heavy standard trees shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved in the first available planting season following the completion of the development or prior to the occupation of any part of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees which die within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development or removed or become seriously damaged or diseased or are dying, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of the same approved specification, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation. 

Reason: To enhance etc.,

Condition : 8 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 9 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) ) Non-material amendments were made during the applications process
  iii) An extended expiry was agreed with the applicant. 
   iv) The application was approved without delay.
